main event: Three to four green ball-shaped objects were observed moving from North to South and disintegrated over the Southeastern U.S. on April 22, 1957.
interesting points: The objects were seen by numerous observers across a wide area at the same time., The objects appeared very close to the observers but were actually very high up., The sighting indicated that they were likely astronomical meteors., The objects left a trail of smoke as they moved., The weather conditions were clear at the time of the sighting.
sighted object: three to four green ball-shaped objects
witness description: civilian witnesses from various locations in the Southeastern U.S.
